ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Would definitely recommend the course. Excellent introduction to and deep engagement with spatial theory and the enmeshed terrain of history and space.
I would recommend the class to a fellow student, but just warn them that they need to start very early on their projects to get the most out of them.
Great course that I would recommend to anyone interested in spatial history and problems of space
It's a seminar mostly focused on historiography, with the expectation of a large research paper. I would recommend it to another student.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course indirectly helped tremendously with my dissertation project. It was helpful in orienting my work across, between and within history and environmental/geography disciplines.

This course was important for me personally in introducing me to some theory I have been meaning to read. It was also helpful in providing an incentive for me to learn GIS, at least the basics, though I had to do this outside of class rather than being able to learn it in class.

This class exposed me to a whole new aspect of historical thinking and inquiry that I would not normally have encountered. It also provided me with a basic introduction to some new research tools that I would otherwise not have found.
